item.title: Apple could launch AI-powered smart glasses in 2026
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Apple is reportedly looking to release a pair of smart glasses by the end of next year in a bid to compete with Meta’s AI-powered glasses, the Ray-Ban Meta. Apple’s wearable will have all the components one would expect in smart glasses, including a camera and microphone, and will have the ability to analyze what’s […]

item.title: Trump threatens 25% tariffs on iPhones made outside the US
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: President Trump lashed out at Apple on Friday, threatening the company with a 25% tariff on iPhones unless it moves production to the U.S. “I have long ago informed Tim Cook of Apple that I expect their iPhone’s [sic] that will be sold in the United States of America will be manufactured and built in […]

item.title: Mysterious hacking group Careto was run by the Spanish government, sources say
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The elusive hacking group Careto was never publicly linked to a specific government, but TechCrunch has learned researchers concluded privately that the Spanish government was behind the group.

item.title: After Klarna, Zoom’s CEO also uses an AI avatar on quarterly call
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: After Klarna CEO, Zoom's CEO opts to use AI avatar for initial comments during the earnings call

item.title: Anthropic CEO claims AI models hallucinate less than humans
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei believes today’s AI models hallucinate, or make things up and present them as if they’re true, at a lower rate than humans do, he said during a press briefing at Anthropic’s first developer event, Code with Claude, in San Francisco on Thursday. Amodei said all this in the midst of a […]

item.title: Hinge Health pops 17%, but joins growing ranks of down-round IPOs
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Hinge Health, a digital physical therapy company, closed its first day of trading on the New York Stock Exchange on Thursday at $37.56, up about 17% over the $32 IPO price it set the previous day. That’s a good first-day result. But even with the pop, Hinge’s public valuation is significantly less than its last […]

item.title: Klarna CEO and Sutter Hill take victory lap after Jony Ive’s OpenAI deal
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Hours after Sam Altman and Jony Ive announced on Wednesday that OpenAI was buying Ive’s company, io, in an all-stock transaction valued at $6.5 billion, Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski posted a surprising message on X. Siemiatkowski’s family investment office, Flat Capital, had bought shares in io six months earlier, he said. Since this is an […]

item.title: Bluesky will begin verifying ‘notable’ users
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Bluesky on Thursday quietly opened the doors to those who want to become verified on its social networking service. In a post published by the Bluesky Safety account, the company announced that “notable and authentic” accounts can now apply for verification through a new online form. Plus, organizations can request to become a Trusted Verifier […]

item.title: Anthropic’s latest flagship AI sure seems to love using the ‘cyclone’ emoji
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Anthropic’s new flagship AI model, Claude Opus 4, is a strong programmer and writer, the company claims. When talking to itself, it’s also a prolific emoji user. That’s according to a technical report Anthropic released on Thursday, a part of which investigates how Opus 4 behaves in “open-ended self-interaction” — i.e. essentially having a chat […]

item.title: Tinder CEO to step down in July
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Faye Iosotaluno, the CEO of Tinder, will step down from her role in July, according to a post she published on LinkedIn.  Iosotaluno served less than two years in the role and spent nearly eight years overall at the company, which is owned by Match Group. In her post, she said she was “especially proud […]

item.title: Senate votes to revoke California’s ability to set air pollution standards
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The state was to require increasing sales of zero-emissions cars and passenger trucks starting in 2026.

item.title: A safety institute advised against releasing an early version of Anthropic’s Claude Opus 4 AI model
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: A third-party research institute that Anthropic partnered with to test one of its new flagship AI models, Claude Opus 4, recommended against deploying an early version of the model due to its tendency to “scheme” and deceive. According to a safety report Anthropic published Thursday, the institute, Apollo Research, conducted tests to see in which […]

item.title: Microsoft says Lumma password stealer malware found on 394,000 Windows PCs
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Microsoft and law enforcement announced a coordinated takedown of the Lumma pasword-stealing malware.

item.title: Mozilla is shutting down read-it-later app Pocket
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Mozilla announced on Thursday that it’s shutting down Pocket, a read-it-later app it acquired in 2017, on July 8. The company is also shutting down Fakespot, its browser extension that helps users identify unreliable reviews. “Pocket has helped millions save articles and discover stories worth reading,” Mozilla said in a blog post. “But the way […]

item.title: Anthropic’s new AI model turns to blackmail when engineers try to take it offline
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Anthropic’s newly launched Claude Opus 4 model frequently tries to blackmail developers when they threaten to replace it with a new AI system and give it sensitive information about the engineers responsible for the decision, the company said in a safety report released Thursday. During pre-release testing, Anthropic asked Claude Opus 4 to act as […]

item.title: Open social web browser Surf makes it easier for anyone to build custom feeds
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: With Starter Sets, Surf is simplifying the process of building those custom feeds, personalizing them, and even publishing them off-platform, if you choose.

item.title: Meta adds another 650 MW of solar power to its AI push
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The company already has more than 12 gigawatts of capacity in its renewable power portfolio.

item.title: Anthropic’s new Claude 4 AI models can reason over many steps
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: During its inaugural developer conference Thursday, Anthropic launched two new AI models that the startup claims are among the industry’s best, at least in terms of how they score on popular benchmarks. Claude Opus 4 and Claude Sonnet 4, part of Anthropic’s new Claude 4 family of models, can analyze large datasets, execute long-horizon tasks, […]

item.title: SpaceX’s Starship cleared to return to flight with expanded ‘hazard areas’
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The Federal Aviation Administration has cleared SpaceX to perform the ninth test flight of its Starship rocket system, following back-to-back explosions earlier this year. The agency said Thursday it is “expanding the size of hazard areas both in the U.S. and other countries” for the flight based on an updated safety analysis provided by SpaceX. […]

item.title: Vercel debuts an AI model optimized for web development
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: The team behind Vercel’s V0, an AI-powered platform for web creation, has developed an AI model it claims excels at certain website development tasks. Available through an API, the model, called “v0-1.0-md,” can be prompted with text or images, and was “optimized for front-end and full-stack web development,” the Vercel team says. Currently in beta, […]
